content.statement: paes-001-definition is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Rare-Syndromes Popliteal-Entrapment that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding paes-001-definition helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of paes-001-definition include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of paes-001-definition.

whelan_classification.type_I: Artery courses medial to and beneath normal medial head of gastrocnemius
whelan_classification.type_II: Abnormal medial insertion of medial head causes lateral artery displacement
whelan_classification.type_III: Accessory slip of gastrocnemius slings around artery
whelan_classification.type_IV: Artery runs deep to popliteus muscle or fibrous band
whelan_classification.type_V: Popliteal vein entrapped (with or without artery)
whelan_classification.type_VI: Functional - normal anatomy with hypertrophied gastrocnemius

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity
definitions_glossary.relationship: A connection or association between concepts

epidemiology.gender: Male > female (though functional more common in females)

diagnosis.clinical: Young athlete with claudication, diminished pulses with provocation
diagnosis.provocation_test: Active plantarflexion or passive dorsiflexion reduces pulse/flow
diagnosis.mra_cta: Best for anatomic definition, also done with provocation
diagnosis.angiography: With plantar flexion if other imaging inconclusive

surgical.myotomy: Release of anomalous muscle/tendon - for mild disease, normal artery
surgical.bypass: If arterial damage present (thrombosis, stenosis, aneurysm)
surgical.approach: Posterior (medial) approach for muscle release; medial for bypass

treatment.endovascular: Generally avoided - treats effect not cause, poor results
treatment.contralateral_screening: 25-30% bilateral - assess other leg even if asymptomatic

definition.@value: Compression of popliteal artery by anomalous musculotendinous structures causing claudication in young athletes

clinical_pearls: Young athlete + claudication + no risk factors = PAES until proven otherwise
Provocation (plantarflexion) during imaging is KEY to diagnosis
25-30% bilateral - always check the other leg
Treat the cause (muscle release), not just the effect (artery) - endovascular fails

medicalCode.description: Other specified disorders of arteries and arterioles

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
